author: Source
title: Viola Davis delivers moving speech after winning best supporting actress - video | Global | The Guardian
text:
Viola Davis Viola Davis delivers moving speech after winning best supporting actress - video 
Viola Davis wins the Academy Award for best supporting actress for her role in Fences. In the film, Davis plays a mother determined to hold her family together despite the rages of her husband, who is played by best actor nominee Denzel Washington. In her emotional acceptance speech, Davis said: ‘I became an artist, and thank God I did, because we are the only profession that celebrates what it means to live a life’. View more sharing options
